page.title: 16ECOLOGY
page.content: The Coxtie landfill site is almost opposite Peniel Academy in Coxtie Green Road.During the history of tipping at Coxtie there have been several pollutions of the stream which flows thrugh Foxdown wood, providing half of the inflow water to the lakes in the park. This stream rises at a spring under the tip. In order to prevent furthur pollution, which caused serious losses of fish in the early 1970's, this spring is now piped directly into the stream. Drainage water from the tip itself is pumped in to the main sewer for treatment before it is released into rivers. The spring water and inflow to the lakes are sampled regularly in order to check the success of this arrangement. Coxtie tip is due for incorporation into the South Weald Country park.
